subject: Sleep
title: Factory Shifts and Sleep Destruction
description: A quick, practical guide to Factory Shifts and Sleep Destruction.

hook.text: The industrial revolution didn't just change work. It destroyed the natural relationship between humans and sleep.

buildup.text: Factories ran 24 hours. Workers rotated between day and night shifts with no regard for circadian biology.

discovery.text: Children as young as six worked 14-hour shifts, sleeping in shifts on shared beds that were never cold.

twist.text: The concept of sleeping through the night as a single eight-hour block was invented to match factory shift patterns.

climax.text: Our modern sleep schedule is not natural. It was designed to serve industrial productivity.

punchline.text: We sleep in eight-hour blocks because factories needed us to.

quiz.question: Why did the eight-hour sleep block become standard?
options: It's the natural human sleep pattern
It was designed to fit factory shift schedules
Doctors prescribed it in ancient times
